00144 int nfs_Setattr( nfs_arg_t               * parg    ,
00145                  exportlist_t            * pexport ,
00146                  fsal_op_context_t       * pcontext   ,
00147                  cache_inode_client_t    * pclient ,
00148                  hash_table_t            * ht      ,
00149                  struct svc_req          * preq    ,
00150                  nfs_res_t               * pres     )
00151 {
00152         static char     funcName[] = "nfs_Setattr";
00153 
00154 
00155   sattr3                   new_attributes3  ;
00156   sattr2                   new_attributes2  ;
00157   fsal_attrib_list_t       setattr          ;
00158   cache_entry_t          * pentry = NULL    ;
00159   fsal_attrib_list_t       pre_attr         ;
00160   fsal_attrib_list_t       parent_attr      ;
00161   fsal_attrib_list_t       attr             ;
00162   fsal_attrib_list_t     * ppre_attr        ;
00163   cache_inode_file_type_t  filetype         ;
00164   cache_inode_status_t     cache_status     ; 
00165   int                      rc               ;
00166   int                      do_trunc = FALSE ;
00167 
00168         if( preq->rq_vers == NFS_V3 )
00169         {
00170                 /* to avoid setting it on each error case */
00171                 pres->res_setattr3.SETATTR3res_u.resfail.obj_wcc.before.attributes_follow = FALSE;
00172                 pres->res_setattr3.SETATTR3res_u.resfail.obj_wcc.after.attributes_follow = FALSE;
00173                 ppre_attr = NULL;
00174         }
00175   
00176         /* Convert file handle into a vnode */
00177   if( ( pentry = nfs_FhandleToCache( preq->rq_vers, 
00178                                      &(parg->arg_setattr2.file),
00179                                      &(parg->arg_setattr3.object),
00180                                      NULL, 
00181                                      &(pres->res_attr2.status),
00182                                      &(pres->res_setattr3.status),
00183                                      NULL, 
00184                                      &pre_attr, 
00185                                      pcontext, 
00186                                      pclient, 
00187                                      ht, 
00188                                      &rc ) ) == NULL )
00189     {
00190       /* Stale NFS FH ? */
00191       return rc ;
00192     }
00193 
00194   /* get directory attributes before action (for V3 reply) */
00195   ppre_attr = &pre_attr ;
00196   
00197   switch (preq->rq_vers)
00198   {
00199     case NFS_V2:
00200       
00201       new_attributes2 = parg->arg_setattr2.attributes;
00202       /*
00203        * Check for 2Gb limit in V2 
00204        */
00205       if( ( parg->arg_setattr2.attributes.size != (u_int)-1 ) &&
00206         ( pre_attr.filesize > NFS2_MAX_FILESIZE ) )
00207       {
00208           /*
00209            *  They are trying to set the size, the
00210            *  file is >= 2GB and V2 clients don't
00211            *  understand filesizes >= 2GB, so we
00212            *  don't allow them to alter them in any
00213            *  way.
00214            */
00215           pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_FBIG;
00216           return NFS_REQ_OK ;    
00217       }
00218        
00219       if( nfs2_Sattr_To_FSALattr( &setattr,
00220                                   &new_attributes2 ) == 0 )
00221         {
00222           pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_IO ;
00223           return NFS_REQ_OK; 
00224         }
00225         
00226       if ( new_attributes2.size != (u_int)-1 )
00227           do_trunc = TRUE;
00228        
00229       break;
00230       
00231     case NFS_V3:
00232           new_attributes3 = parg->arg_setattr3.new_attributes;
00233 
00234       if (parg->arg_setattr3.guard.check == TRUE)
00235         {
00236           /* This pack of lines implements the "guard check" setattr.
00237            * This feature of nfsv3 is used to avoid several setattr 
00238            * to occur concurently on the same object, from different clients */
00239           fattr3          attributes;
00240           
00241           if( nfs3_FSALattr_To_Fattr( pexport, ppre_attr, &attributes ) == 0 )
00242             {
00243               pres->res_setattr3.status = NFS3ERR_NOT_SYNC;
00244               return NFS_REQ_OK; 
00245             }
00246           
00247 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
00248           printf( "css=%d acs=%d    csn=%d acn=%d\n", 
00249                   parg->arg_setattr3.guard.sattrguard3_u.obj_ctime.seconds,
00250                   attributes.ctime.seconds,
00251                   parg->arg_setattr3.guard.sattrguard3_u.obj_ctime.nseconds,
00252                   attributes.ctime.nseconds ) ;
00253 #endif          
00254           if ((parg->arg_setattr3.guard.sattrguard3_u.obj_ctime.seconds != attributes.ctime.seconds) ||
00255               (parg->arg_setattr3.guard.sattrguard3_u.obj_ctime.nseconds != attributes.ctime.nseconds))
00256             {
00257               pres->res_setattr3.status = NFS3ERR_NOT_SYNC;
00258               return NFS_REQ_OK;
00259             }
00260         }
00261 
00262       /* 
00263        * Conversion to FSAL attributes 
00264        */
00265       if( nfs3_Sattr_To_FSALattr( &setattr, 
00266                                   &new_attributes3 ) == 0 )
00267           {
00268             pres->res_setattr3.status = NFS3ERR_INVAL ;
00269             return NFS_REQ_OK; 
00270           }
00271           
00272       if ( new_attributes3.size.set_it )
00273         {
00274           do_trunc = TRUE;
00275         }
00276       
00277       break;
00278     }
00279   
00280 
00281         /*
00282          * trunc may change Xtime so we have to start with trunc and finish
00283          * by the mtime and atime 
00284          */
00285    if( do_trunc )
00286     {
00287       /* Should not be done on a directory */
00288       if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING || pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00289          cache_status = CACHE_INODE_IS_A_DIRECTORY ;
00290       else
00291         { 
00292           cache_status = cache_inode_truncate( pentry, 
00293                                                setattr.filesize, 
00294                                                &parent_attr, 
00295                                                ht, 
00296                                                pclient, 
00297                                                pcontext, 
00298                                                &cache_status ) ;
00299           setattr.asked_attributes &= ~FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED ;
00300           setattr.asked_attributes &= ~FSAL_ATTR_SIZE ;
00301         }
00302     }
00303   else
00304     cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00305   
00306   
00307 
00308   if( cache_status == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00309     {
00310       /* Add code to support partially completed setattr */
00311       if( do_trunc )
00312         {
00313           if( setattr.asked_attributes != 0 )
00314             {
00315               cache_status =  cache_inode_setattr ( pentry, 
00316                                                     &setattr, 
00317                                                     ht, 
00318                                                     pclient, 
00319                                                     pcontext,
00320                                                     &cache_status ) ;
00321             }
00322           else
00323             cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00324           
00325           setattr.asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED ;
00326           setattr.asked_attributes |= FSAL_ATTR_SIZE ;
00327         }
00328       else
00329         cache_status =  cache_inode_setattr ( pentry, 
00330                                                     &setattr, 
00331                                                     ht, 
00332                                                     pclient, 
00333                                                     pcontext,
00334                                               &cache_status ) ;
00335       }
00336   
00337 
00338   if( cache_status == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) 
00339     {
00340       /* Set the NFS return */
00341       switch( preq->rq_vers )
00342         {
00343         case NFS_V2:
00344           /* Copy data from vattr to Attributes */
00345           if( nfs2_FSALattr_To_Fattr( pexport, &setattr, &(pres->res_attr2.ATTR2res_u.attributes) ) == 0 )
00346             pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_IO ;
00347           else
00348             pres->res_attr2.status = NFS_OK ;
00349           break;
00350           
00351         case NFS_V3:
00352           /* Build Weak Cache Coherency data */
00353           nfs_SetWccData( pcontext, pexport,
00354                           pentry, 
00355                           ppre_attr, 
00356                           &setattr,
00357                           &(pres->res_setattr3.SETATTR3res_u.resok.obj_wcc) );
00358           
00359           pres->res_setattr3.status = NFS3_OK;
00360           break;
00361         }
00362       
00363       return NFS_REQ_OK;
00364     }
00365  
00366 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO 
00367   printf( "nfs_Setattr: failed\n" ) ;
00368 #endif
00369 
00370   /* If we are here, there was an error */
00371   if( nfs_RetryableError( cache_status) )
00372     return NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00373   
00374         nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport, 
00375                        preq->rq_vers, 
00376                        cache_status,
00377                        &pres->res_attr2.status,
00378                        &pres->res_setattr3.status,
00379                        NULL, NULL,
00380                        pentry,
00381                        ppre_attr,
00382                        &(pres->res_setattr3.SETATTR3res_u.resfail.obj_wcc),
00383                        NULL, NULL, NULL);
00384   
00385         return NFS_REQ_OK;
00386 } /* nfs_Setattr */
00387

00397 void nfs_Setattr_Free( nfs_res_t * resp )
00398 {
00399   /* Nothing to do here */
00400   return ;
00401 } /* nfs_Setattr_Free */
